body.p: Before taking the quiz below, consider again the learning objectives or this unit on feedback loops, receptors, control centers, and integration of body systems to maintain chemical, molecular, and cellular homeostasis. Could you demonstrate your knowledge of each of these objectives? If so, you will be ready for the assessment. If not, consider reviewing content related to these objectives before attempting the assessment.

li.p: Define homeostasis and describe the multiple levels of homeostatic maintenance in physiology.
Describe the components of a feedback loop. Compare and contrast positive and negative feedback in terms of the relationship between stimulus and response.
Provide an example of a positive feedback loop. Describe the specific structures (organs, cells or molecules) included in the feedback loop.
Provide an example of a negative feedback loop that utilizes the nervous system to relay information. Describe the specific structures (organs, cells or molecules) included in the feedback loop.
List the components of a feedback loop and explain the function of each.
Describe how abnormalities in homeostatic feedback loops lead to disease states.
Predict the types of problems that would occur if the cells could not maintain homeostasis.
Explain how different organ systems relate to one another to maintain homeostasis.
